newledo residency opportunity

For Regenerative Focused Makers, Innovators, Designers and Artists
Newledo offers short and long term residency opportunities for innovators and creative practitioners to conceptualize, develop or build out work that responds to the 18-acre farm or the broader bioregion, addresses the climate crisis, engages the public in regenerative principles or advances solutions for greater resiliency and climate conscious living.

Our vision is to bring together practitioners in seemingly disparate fields, in the belief that unique synergy and innovation can come from cross pollination.

Newledo’s secondary mission is to invite in the public for immersive learning and first hand experience with these regenerative designs and practice. This provides an opportunity for residents to get exposure, feedback and interest on the part of the public and/or investors and supporters. They would also be invited to host a demonstration of an early stage prototype or refined solution or install such works for short or long term evaluation.
Residency includes furnished housing, wifi, use of all shared common areas in the main house, access to a studio space in the barn, use of the wood shop or other areas for fabrication.

Newledo will provide connections in the region, and help with promotion for events and exhibits. We can also provide brainstorming sessions and strategizing for advancing and promoting your work, and marketing and business development guidance.

Rooms are available for the week, month or year, depending on the need. Alternate housing such as tiny house parking or camping is also welcome.

We ourselves are artists and industrial designers and love connecting with other practitioners. Consider being part of our vibrant community!

To learn more about Newledo’s residency program, contact Nicole Cousino, nicole@newledohub.org
